verbs.description: underbuy (third-person singular simple present underbuys, present participle underbuying, simple past and past participle underbought)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To buy at less than the value of.
(transitive) To buy at less than the price of another.

examples: Well, just as you can overbuy when selecting a home, you can underbuy. That's what Nathan and Rebecca did when they bought their first home. They believed in living within their means — a good thing — but they took it to an extreme.
